Mr.Nyamzav, 39 years old, lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. His wife works as a dressmaker at a cashmere business. He has been working as a bus driver since 2006. 

Building of the family's home began two years ago, with the help of Kiva lenders. This time, Nyamzav wants to purchase some necessary home furniture such as a chair, a table and a chest of drawers. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase these items. 

As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place, and will work more enthusiastically. The borrower is a very hardworking and reliable individual who strives for better life.

loans.use: To purchase home furniture.

loans.name: Louel

texts.en: Louel lives in Gata Daku, Clarin. He has earned his living by providing transportation services for 3 years; with this money, he provides for the needs of his child. He gets an income of 4,000 PHP a month from this business. For a 29-year old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his child successful in its studies. Without hesitation, Louel is borrowing 10,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair his transport vehicle for his business. He joined GDMPC in 2010. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle for his business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is 29 years old, and still single. He has been engaged in a hog-raising business for two years, and earns approximately PHP 8,000 every four months. He says that the most tiresome part is to clean the piggery every day. 

He wants to provide the necessities needed for his pigs, therefore he is requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for his pigs. 

He hopes this will make them fit and nourished to provide higher sales at selling time; he hopes to grow his business to secure his family living.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 36 years old and married to Janet. The couple supports a family of seven. For the past six years, Patrick has operated a welding business in the Bomet area and he earns a monthly income of 51,000 KES. 

Patrick is requesting a 35,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to add to his savings and purchase a bigger welding machine. This will be his second loan. Patrick plans to use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his business. He also hopes to provide for his family's basic needs, become financially stable, and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a welding machine

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos de 32 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa, dos hijos y su madre de avanzada edad y quien depende por completo de él. Carlos es una persona responsable y trabajadora que se dedica a transportar personas en su pequeño camión y así mismo a transportar muebles y realizar trabajo de mudanza para quienes solicite sus servicios. Con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio, él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual cuente con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de llantas para su camión y así mismo realizarle otros arreglos, para Carlos la seguridad de sus clientes es muy importante, razón por la que también cuenta con muchos clientes ya que es muy conocido por esto. Brindar servicio de transporte es la forma en que Carlos lleva el sustento a su hogar por lo que es imprescindible mejorar su servicio constantemente y así tener un negocio fijo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32 years old, lives together with his wife, two children and his elderly mother who depends completely on him.  Carlos is a responsible and hardworking person who makes a living transporting people in his small truck as well as transporting furniture and performing moving jobs for those who seek his services.  

With the goal of providing a better service, he is requesting a loan from Integral, with which he will have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of tires for his truck and also carry out other repairs.  The safety of his customers is very important for Carlos, for this reason he also has many clients since he is well-known for this.  Providing transport service is the way in which Carlos brings sustenance to his home so it is essential to constantly improve his service and thus have a steady business.

loans.use: to buy tires for truck maintenance.

loans.name: Jennefer

texts.en: Jennefer is a 27-year-old living in Gata Daku, Clarin. She has provided for the needs of her child from the small sum of 6,000 PHP per month that she has been earning for 4 years from her corn production business. Her business is an aid to the income that her husband earns from painting. In 2011, Jennefer joined GDMPC, and she is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and married with three children. For the past six years, she has been a dairy farmer and she also raises chickens. She relies on her husband's income and she also owns some rental houses. Mary used her previous loan to buy a dairy cow. Her business did well and she successfully repaid her loan. Mary is very hardworking and Faulu Kenya has helped her to increase her profits. 

Mary is requesting a 63,585 KES loan to buy chicks to raise. In the future, she hopes to buy a van and become the main supplier of eggs in her area.

loans.use: to buy chicks

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 48 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 12 years, Estela has operated a retail business. She is thankful for the income she has generated through her work as it has been a great help for her children's education. Estela's major business challenge is the lack of adequate capital. 

Estela is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through ASKI to purchase more fish, vegetables, and vinegar to sell in the market. She knows that with her loan and her hard work, she can increase her profit to make her business successful and continue to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fish, vegetables, and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Jonald

texts.en: Jonald is a responsible husband. He is 28 years old. He raises hogs and sells them for a profit. He wants to have more hogs to raise, and this is why he is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy vaccines, feed and medicine to sustain his hogs. Aside from raising hogs, he also raises chickens and will buy feed for them, too. With hard work and the help of his wife, he hopes to achieve economic stability someday.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and medicine to sustain his hogs.

loans.name: Kyen

texts.en:
Kyen is married with five children. She lives in Nchuobu Junction, Bamenda, Cameroon.
  
She has had to overcome some challenges in life, such as ill health and the difficulties she faces paying her children's school fees. She does trading to earn a living.

This will be her second time to receive a loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2011. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business and her reasonable prices. With her increased experience, she is now having good profit from her business.
 
With this loan, she plans to buy plantains, yams and cocoyams and pay for transportation to and from the bush market. She thinks her business will succeed because she has already mastered the business, because she is located at a junction where so many people pass through and also because she has many customers.
 
Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family and give them good medication whenever they are sick. She will plow part back into her farm.

loans.use: to buy plantains, yams and cocoyams.

loans.name: Glenard

texts.en:
Glenard is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Glenard has a tricycle that he operates everyday as a source of income. He has had this business for over 2 years. He requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for new tires and motorcycle maintenance. In the future, Glenard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for new tires and motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a married lady, age 35. She is blessed with two children, ages 14 and 2. She operates a clothing boutique shop in Narok town area and has been running the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

She is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to purchase more clothing for the business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children. Her dream is to improve her living standard and own a residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 30 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past five years, Margret has been working hard to manage her small shop where she sells plastic household items. 

Margret is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to buy more plastic items to sell. Her loan will help her to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to construct over 10 rental houses to provide 100,000 UGX each month. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy plastic items to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen, 43 years old, is a single entrepreneur from Magcamiguing, Calamba. He is earning from his transport service business. It started almost two years ago, and he now earns 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month. 

To improve business, Allen is borrowing the amount of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, which he just joined recently, to obtain accessories and tires. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to obtain accessories and tires.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Born in 1947, Adamu is married and has seven children. They live in a six-room apartment in Alachu Mankon Bamenda, Cameroon. 

Adamu has been facing diificulties in life which has hindered his raising enough capital to carry out a lucrative business. The greatest challenge he had in life was the fact that his father died when he was very young and did not give him a good education. 

He joined Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) in 2011. Since then, he has received and repaid one loan.

With this new loan, Adamu plans to buy wood for the construction of a pig fence, buy bags of pig feed, piglets, and also to buy feeders. He says his activity will succeed because he has obtained some training on pig farming, he knows where to buy a good breed of piglets, and because he has a piece of land where he will construct his pig fence.

Adamu says he will use part of his profit to pay school fees for his children and also to take care of the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase wood for construction of a pig fence, pig feed, and piglets for a pig farm.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en: Celestina is 49 years old and is from Calaran, Calamba. She is married and blessed with 3 children. Celestina is working as chief baker to help the family to earn for a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns about 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) per month. In 2012, Celestina joined GDMPC. She requested a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase new baking equipment & tools to expand the business. Celestina plans to invest the income generated from her loan in the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase new baking equipment & tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara is a 61-year-old married woman, a mother of a 15-year-old daughter, and is from Ubay, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (variety store) business for more than 16 years now. This is the source of her income. Clara is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater and sell more to her buyers thus augmenting her sales and income. Clara hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza, 48, has hopes of success in the near future. But for now, she is working so hard for the opportunity to experience a better living. 

She is selling “ukay-ukay” (second-hand clothing) in the village, which is providing her daily expenses for living. She wants to purchase more clothes, but insufficient capital hinders her. This causes Flordeliza to requests a loan of 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy shorts, blouses and t-shirts. 

Flordeliza hopes for the development of her income this time in order to experience soon the prosperity of life.

loans.use: to buy shorts, blouses and t-shirts.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is married and has three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. 

Luzminda owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Luzminda has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. Luzminda aims to expand her business to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Florecitas Group

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es madre soltera, tiene 24 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos pequeños, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, ropa típica para mujeres en la plaza de comunidad, inicio este negocio con el fin de mejorar su condición de vida y tener un negocio estable, hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia.


Organiza un grupo de señoras y solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería, consistente en cortes, blusas, fajas, sabanas, etc, espera seguir mejorando su negocio, ya que el el futuro tendrá un negocio amplio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedica al comercio de ropa nueva y usada también. 2 de las personas en la fotos no calificaron  para un crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a single mother who is 24 years old.  She didn’t have the opportunity to attend school.  She has two small children.  She makes a living in the business of selling new and used clothing and traditional clothing for women in the community market.  She started this business with the goal of improving her living conditions and having a stable business.  To date she has seven years of experience.

She has organized a group of woman and she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy merchandise which consists of traditional woven skirts, blouses, waist sashes, blankets, etc.   She hopes to continue improving her business so that in the future she will have a large business.  

The rest of the members of the group also make a living in the business of selling new and used clothing.  Two of the people in the photo did not qualify for a loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as skirts, blouses, sashes, blankets, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Del Carmen

texts.es: Margarita del Carmen de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y su nieto; ella se dedica a la venta de comida desayunos y almuerzos como tamales, huevos, frijoles, sopas, carnes, ensaladas entre otros; tiene varios años con el negocio y  eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia en un lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades y es muy conocida por todas las personas de la comunidad pues prepara las comidas mas deliciosas de la zona, ya tiene mucha clientela fija que la prefiere porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, a buen precio y sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Margarita es una mujer activa, emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y siempre dispuesta a luchar por encontrar las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así cumplirá su objetivo, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INNTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, pollos, verduras, carne, huevos, bebidas, etc. Margarita del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Margarita del Carmen is forty-seven years of age and lives with her life partner and her grandson.  She earns her living selling meals: breakfasts and lunches such as tamales, eggs, beans, soups, meat dishes and salads, among other things.  She has been running the business for a number of years and, through it, has gained plenty of sales experience, which allows her to make bigger profits.  She plies her trade in a place which she considers very favourable for her business and she is well known throughout her community for preparing the most delicious dishes in the area.  She now has a large regular clientele who prefer her because she sells only goods of the highest quality, prices them reasonably and, above all, delivers excellent service. 

Margarita is busy, enterprising, dedicated to her work and always willing to strive to find the best opportunities for success.  Her greatest secret is hard work and love of the job which, she knows, are the only ways to achieve her ambition.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to capitalise on this by making a new investment.  To do this she needs capital and is, therefore, seeking an INTEGRAL loan to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat, eggs, drinks, etc.  Margarita del Carmen has good repayment references and is highly responsible.  She guarantees that she will be able to repay her debts and, at the same time, is confident that she can provide a full life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, chickens, vegetables, meat, eggs and drinks

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 41 years old and married with five children ages four, six, eight, ten, and 12. For the past seven years, she has been buying and reselling scrap metal in the Bomet area. Gladys earns a monthly income of 24,500 KES. 

Gladys is requesting a 30,000 KES loan through KADET LTD to purchase additional metal for her business. This will be her second loan. Gladys will use the anticipated profit from her loan to provide for her family's basic needs. In the future, she hopes to diversify her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metal

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy is 37 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Cristy lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last 5 years by selling home and used products. She makes 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month and is applying for a loan for 25,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Cristy joined GDMPC in 2011 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique's primary source of income comes from farming, planting and harvesting rice to sell. He had been in the business for over 10 years. Enrique is now 40 years old and married to Mary Ann who works abroad. They have two children attending to school.

Enrique is a responsible father and wanted to give the best education to his children. He is now asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy insecticides and fertilizers, and to pay for farm labor. He hopes to keep acquiring abundant harvests that will lead to additional income for the sustenance of his family. He promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers, and to pay labor cost in farming

loans.name: Nebah

texts.en:
He is married and has two children below the age of 15. They live in a two-room apartment in Bamenda in the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
He has encountered problems including the death of his father, a sickness that required an operation, the sickness of his daughter and a recent accident. Inadequate finance to start a business and provide square meals to his children and to cater to their education is also a challenge.

With the new loan, he plans to purchase fuel wood for resale, fowls and their feed, and planks for his wood workshop expansion. He believes this his business will succeed because he has being keeping fowls for a long time, he is also a trained carpenter, there is high demand for fuel wood in the community, and he has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from him. 

The community will benefit because they will not go a long distance to buy wood. He will also produce chairs, beds, and repairs for the public.

The profits will help him in improving the housing conditions of the family, providing better education for the family and expanding his business. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase fuel wood for resale, fowls, and planks to expand his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio, 30 years of age, is married and has one child. 

He has had a motor spare parts retailing business for almost one year. 

He is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 to purchase additional motor parts to sell. His monthly net income is PHP 10,000. His profits are used to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase motor spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 44 years old and is married. She had three children who are studying. She is engaged in growing and selling vegetables in the village. Aside from this business, she also has a hog-raising business. 

To cover the needs of her businesses, she is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetable seeds and feed for her hog. She hopes that she can gain more income now that could let her save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hog and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.name: Habonaya

texts.en:
Habonaya is a 37-year-old charcoal dealer in Tudor, Mombasa. She is a widow who has been in this business for the last four years. 

She is requesting her second loan to buy more stock of charcoal for sale. 

She supports three children and has a great income. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her previous loan was paid successfully and she hopes to uplift her business and have a well maintained family in future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Neba

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with six children, two below the age of 15. They live in a four room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. She has encountered so many challenges in life such as death, sickness, at times no support, illness of her children, inadequate finance to start up business, providing square meals to her children and paying for her children's education.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase articles which are provision items like beans, rice, plantains, cocoyam. The rest of the loan will be used to buy fowl and the feed needed for the upkeep of the fowl. She believes her business will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for food stuff such as beans and yams in the community. She has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from her for resale and restaurants. The community will benefit because they will not go long distance to buy food items.

The profits will help her increase her business, provide better education for the family and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: purchase beans, provision items, plantains, fowl, and cocoyam.

loans.name: Rieza Jane

texts.en:
Rieza Jane, age 24, is married with 1 child. She is from Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rieza Jane manages a retail business where she sells a variety of meat and food products for a living. The work gives her a total monthly income of 10,000 PHP. 

In 2012, she joined GDMPC. Rieza Jane has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase additional products like seasonings, meats, etc. She hopes to spare a portion of her earnings for maintenance costs and to expand her current offerings.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like seasonings, meats, etc.

loans.name: Muikonyi

texts.en:
Muikonyi lives in Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business from the income of subsistence farming. The extract from tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business of tea tree farming this year. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to the group and he joined the group with an aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This, he believes, will be sorted once he purchases a water pump.

Muikonyi is applying for a loan of 2,583 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. His extra income from the loan will be added to the savings. He looks forward to getting the returns once he starts harvesting.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Otgon

texts.en:
Mrs. Otgon is 38 years old and lives with her husband, daughter and her mother in a Ger (Mongolian housing tent) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, Erdenechuluun, is working at a construction site in Ulaanbaatar temporarily. Her daughter, Enhzaya, age 15, goes to a local secondary school. Her mother stays home. 

Otgon has been running her animal hides and pelt retail business since 2000. She has a lot of experience and a large network within the business. She is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of animal pelt and hides since this is the high season in which locals purchase meat in large quantities. She is a hardworking and well-experienced woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and hides since this is the high season in which locals purchase meat in large quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth and thread to make sofa covers.

loans.name: Ambe

texts.en:
Ambe is married and has ten children, three of whom are under the age of fifteen. The family lives in a ten-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. Ambe has encountered many challenges in life, including the death of his first daughter and his father. When he lost his job, it was like the world was coming to an end. Inadequate financing to start up a business, provide square meals to his children and pay for their education is also a problem.

With the new loan, Ambe plans to purchase piglets, construct a modern pigsty, and buy feed for the pigs. He believes that his business will succeed because he has being keeping pigs for a long time, the demand for piglets and pork meat in the community is high, and he has a good business site and regular customers who buy from him for resale and restaurants. The community will benefit because they will not have to go a long distance to buy good piglets and matter for their farm use.

The profits will help Ambe improve the housing conditions of his family, provide better education for his children and expand his project. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education GHAPE provides.

loans.use: purchase piglets and construct a pigsty.

loans.name: Vutsile

texts.en:
Vutsile is married and has six children, five of them below the age of fifteen. They live in a six-room apartment in Bamenda North West region of Cameroon. 

Vutsile has faced challenges in life which includes inadequate finance to start up a business and providing square meals for his children. Catering to his children's education is also a problem.

With this new loan, Vutsile will purchase piglets, construct a modern pig pen, and buy three bags of feed for the pigs. He believes this his business will succeed because he has being keeping pigs for a long time, there is a high demand for piglets and pork meat in the community, he has a good business site, and also regular customers who buy from him for resale and for a restaurant. The community will benefit because they will not have to go long distances to buy good piglets and manure for their farm use.

The profits will help Vutsile to improve the housing conditions of the family, provide better education for the family, and expand his business. He prefers a loan from Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) because of the convenient repayment period, low interest, and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and construct a pig pen.

loans.name: Amalina

texts.en:
Amalina raises her six children through her profits from her sari-sari store business. She is 52 years old and is married. Her husband operates their tricycle for passengers’ transportation. She successfully sent her children to college. They finished their education and now have their own jobs.

Amalina wishes to maintain her good health and be able to run the business until she can do it. She doesn’t want to rely on her children for remittance, that’s why she is running the business for their future. 

Amalina is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy grocery items like canned goods, snack foods and drinks to sell in their village. She hopes to maintain the business and earn income for the future of her husband.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like canned goods, snack foods and drinks to sell in their village.

loans.name: Tsogt

texts.en:
Borrower Mr. Tsogt is 50 years old, married and lives with his family in a small apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. He has a son and a daughter, both of them are employed. His spouse is a retired accountant. Now she stays at home, since she walks with a stick.  

Since 2010, Mr. Tsogt has run a taxi business and supports his family by operating this business. Recently, his mother had a serious illness so his family needs money for her treatment. This loan will be used for his mother’s treatment fee. Tsogt’s short term wish is to quickly treat his mother.

loans.use: to treat his very old-age mother.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 41 years old. She operates a piggery that she wants to improve. She is married and has three school-aged children. Her family’s expenses have abruptly increased, so Flordeliza is aiming to make a higher profit. Because of this, Marites is asking a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She hopes that through her loan, she will provide enough nourishment to her pigs to sell them at a high price. If this happens, she will be able to cover her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vierlito

texts.en: Vierlito's main source of income comes from his hog raising business. He is 43 years old and single. He is from Unidos, Plaridel and been in the hog raising business for 2 years, earning 10,000 PHP a month. Recently, Vierlito joined GDMPC. Vierlito is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Muhehu

texts.en:
Muhehu lives in the Nanyuki area of Central Province, Kenya. He owns a tea tree farming business. He started the business with income from subsistence farming. The extract from the tea tree is used to manufacture cosmetics. He began the business this year. 

He learned about Milango through an employee who invited him to join the group, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit. The main challenge in the area has been the seasonal weather. This he believes will be sorted out once he purchases a water pump.

Muhehu is applying for a loan of 8,419 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy tea tree seedlings for his business. His extra money from the loan will be added to his savings and promises to bring in returns once he starts harvesting.

loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for his business.

loans.name: Enjeh

texts.en:
She is a widow with two children and they live in a two-bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam division of the northwest region of Cameroon.
 
She has faced so many challenges in life, including inadequate finance to educate her children, sickness, death and downfall in business. The death of her son was not easy in her life, and a few months later her husband also passed away.

With the new loan requested, she will expand her business by buying more fowls, constructing a new place for the fowls, buying drinkers and feeders, and the rest of the loan will be used to buy vaccine for the fowls. She will use part of the loan to buy feed in bags. 

She believes this business will succeed because of her longevity in the business and the high demand for fowls in town because of the increasing population. This business will help the community to benefit from a regular supply of fowls at moderate prices.
 
With the profit from the loan she will plough back, provide some basic items for her children's education and add more rooms to her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because interest rates are low, members are educated on loan management before the loans are disbursed and the repayment intervals are convenient.

loans.use: to purchase day-old-chicks and expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ghulam's Group

texts.en:
Ghulam is a 19-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband. Her husband rents out chairs, tables, flowers, lights, and other decoration items for different occasions like: wedding ceremonies, birthday parties, and meetings. They have no children. Ghulam is a very hard-working and independent woman. She helps her husband in the business. 

Ghulam, as a member of five-person lending group (Ghulam's Group), has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she will be purchasing some more chairs, tents, flowers, etc. for her husband's decoration business. 

Since she is living in a rented house with her family, she dreams to build her own house. She also desires to increase her business. Ghulam and her husband are very much thankful to both BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

Note: In the picture Ghulam holds a passbook in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tents, flowers, etc. for her husband's decoration business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Through the hog-fattening business, Editha, aged 41, can send her children to school to finish their education. She wishes for them to become professionals someday. She believes that education will lead them out of poor living. This causes Editha to do all that she can to boost her business.

Now, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her hogs. She hopes that the loan will be a great help in improving her income in order to diminish the financial restraint they are experiencing.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
For over two years in Tipolo, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Jasmine, a 26-year-old married mother of two children, has made a living through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2012, Jasmine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (malted milk), shampoo, and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en: Jerry, aged 36, is blessed with three children. This causes him to work hard to provide for them. He is in the transportation business. He transports passengers every day. Now he is taking a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase new tires for his vehicle and to pay for maintenance. Hopefully, he can provide a better living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and pay for maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
She is married and blessed with four children, two below the age of 15. They live in a three-room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West region of Cameroon. 

She has encountered so many challenges in life, including the death of her mother, the death of one of her children and inadequate finance to start a business and sponsor her children's education.

With the new loan, she plans to purchase provision items such as beans, rice, tin tomatoes, vegetable oil and magi to sell. Part of the loan will be invested in farming and in buying seedlings. She also plans to buy smoked fish in cartons to sell.  

She believes the business will succeed because of her longevity in the business. Also, the demand for foods such as rice and other provision items is high in the community. She has a good business site and also regular customers who buy from her for resale and restaurant. The community will benefit because they will not go a long distance to buy her items, especially smoked fish.

The profits will help her expand her business and provide better education for the family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the convenient repayment period, low interest and the social education they provide.

loans.use: to purchase provision items and smoked fish to sell and seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is married with three children and they live in a two-room apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are accidents of family members, thus, making her spend the little time she has on drugs, also sickness, stress over the death of her parents, and limited funds to educate her children and meet the rising demands of their needs. 

With the new loan requested, Angeline promises to expand her poultry farm by buying more piglets, chicks, animal feed, and seedlings and to rent farm land. She is very positive her business will succeed because she has regular customers who buy her farm output and ready animals for sale, she has experience in the business, and the demand of such products creates her demand in the area. With this activity, the community will benefit from manure which will fertilize their farms, thus, leading to high yields; products will be sold to them at moderate prices.

With the profit from the loan, Angeline will pay her children's school fees and provide their basic needs; she will expand her business by buying more animals for her poultry farm, and also provide medication. To her, Grounded and Holistic Approach for People's Empowerment (GHAPE) loans are preferable because loans are given without collateral and on limited interest rates.

loans.use: to expand her farm.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children. For the past 15 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as beer, lemonade, wine and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more drinks to sell, such as beer, lemonade, and wine. The loan will help Annet to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more drinks such as beer, lemonade, and wine to sell.

loans.name: Ichinkhorloo

texts.en:
Borrower Ichinkhorloo is a married 38-year-old woman who lives with her family in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of the city. She works as a maid at a local high school. She has three girls who attend kindergarten, high school, and a higher education institute.

Ichinkhorloo is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to pay her eldest daughter's tuition fees, and to buy a PC and printer which are really needed for her daughter's studies.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees and to buy a PC and printer for her daughter's studies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 28-years-old woman in Kiembeni, Mombasa. She is married and together with the husband who supports her, they have four children. 
She has been in this business for the last one year and she is doing well. She will use the requested loan to purchase a stock of dried small fish for sale and will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Being her first loan, she hopes to be successful in her business and to prosper further.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of dried small fish for sale.

loans.name: Mbabe

texts.en:
Mbabe is married and has six children. They live in a three-bedroom house in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 
She has faced many challenges in life, which include inadequate finance to educate her children, so the children are frequently driven out of school for lack of school fees, basic text books, and other items like pens, pencils and books.
With the new loan she has requested, she will expand her business by buying more food items like cocoyams (taro), palm oil, tomatoes, maggi and other spices to help her carry out the proper operation of her restaurant. She strongly believes that her business will succeed, because of her longevity and experience in the business, as well as high demand in the locality. She says her business will benefit the community by providing a regular supply of food at moderate prices, and because food is supplied for ceremonial activities like weddings, birthday parties and death memorials at reduced prices.
She will plough back the profit from the loan into the business, provide some basic items for her children’s education, and add more rooms to her house. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, because members are educated on loan management before the loans are disbursed, and because the repayment terms are affordable.

loans.use: to buy cocoyams (taro), palm oil, maggi and other spices, and soap for her restaurant.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en: Randy is 24 years of age, married, and blessed with two children. His source of everyday income is buying and selling vegetables. His business is currently in need of additional funds to buy more vegetables to sell in the village. So Randy is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy string beans, cabbage, squash and gabi (taro). With these funds and his hard work, he knows that he will earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy string beans, cabbage, squash and gabi (taro) for resale.

loans.name: Evelye

texts.en:
Evelye is married with six children and lives in a five-room apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of Cameroon. 
She has faced many challenges in her life, amongst which were the death of her father while she was at a tender age and could not take care of herself as well as poverty in her family causing the children not to have adequate education or three square meals per day.
With the new loan of 200.000 frs requested, she will buy pigs, pig feed and a bag of fertilizer to fertilize her farm. She holds strongly the fact that her business will succeed because she has been doing the business for long with regular customers. She is determined to dedicate all her time towards the realization of this project. With this activity, the community will benefit from the animal droppings, thus fertilizing their farming and leading to improved yields. With the profit from this loan, she will educate her children and expand her business. To her, GHAPE loans are preferable because of convenient repayment intervals and low interest rates compared to other organizations.

loans.use: To buy pigs, pig feed and a bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana lives in the Kutaisi District. She is 45 years old and lives with her grown son. Both family members are unemployed at the moment, and they have no source of income. Manana has requested loans from local credit providers several times, but her loan requests are always rejected because of low income and the lack of experience in new business. 

Her current loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. 

Manana owns a disordered plot of land, which she will clean and make even using the loan funds. After the land is leveled off, Manana will sell it in lots. This will improve the family's income and raise their standard of living. This will also help the family to earn enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market.

loans.use: to level off and clean land for sale.

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 25 years old, and single. Safa lives with three family members, of whom two are employed. 

Safa owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to make a display window and install signage and a rolling shutter for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window and install signage and a rolling shutter for his shop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 43 years old. He runs a green grocer and is a charcoal dealer in Mombasa. He is a married father of three school-going children. He has been in this business for the last 15 years and has done well. 

He is requesting his second loan to purchase a stock of charcoal and to uplift his green grocer shop. He will use the anticipated profit to reinvest in the business and repay his loan. Being his second loan, the first was paid successfully. He hopes to live a happy life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of charcoal and to uplift his green grocer shop.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Teresa del Carmen tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their children in their own home.  She sells women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She sells a variety of shirts, skirts, suits, pants, and other items.  She has done this work for many years and now has a lot of experience which helps her increase her income.  She sells her clothing door-to-door and from her home.  She has many regular clients that prefer buying from her because she always provides what they need, offers affordable prices, sells only high-quality items, and provides excellent service.

Teresa is an entrepreneurial woman that works very hard.  She always fights for what she wants and never stops until she is successful. In the last few months, demand for her clothing has increased.  She wants to take advantage of this opportunity but doesn't have the capital she needs to purchase more clothing to sell.  Therefore, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can purchase more clothing.  Teresa del Carmen has great references and is very responsible.  She assures us that she will be able to repay the loan and at the same time she is confident that she will be able to better provide for her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing for sale.

loans.name: Munguntsetseg

texts.en:
Munguntsetseg, 28, is a married lady who lives with her family in a ger, a Mongolian felt tent, in her father’s yard. She has two daughters, ages 2 and 7. Her older daughter attends primary school. Munguntsetseg’s spouse drives a mixer machine.  

She supports her family by operating a butcher stall in the second largest outdoor market of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) to increase her current assets.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en: Adelina, 59, is married and has nine children, all of whom are already married. She has owned and operated her vulcanizing shop for almost 18 years and earns PHP 22,500 a month. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 30,000 to purchase an electric motor for her shop, in order to improve her business. According to Adelina, she earned money for two of her children to go abroad to work there as overseas Filipino workers.

loans.use: to purchase an electric motor for her vulcanizing shop, in order to improve her business.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji is married with seven children and lives in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.
She has faced many challenges in life, among which were the death of her husband, leaving her alone to cater for their seven children, the death of her sister who was a great support to her after her husband’s death, the death of her father and mother, who also were people of great help to her after her husband’s death, as well as inadequate finances to cater for her children's medication and feeding.
With the new loan requested, she will expand her poultry business by buying more chicks, feed as well as engaging in the buying and selling of firewood. She holds a positive view that her business will succeed because she is well-versed with business tactics, rears a good breed of chicks and also sells at reduced prices compared to her competitors. With this activity, the community will benefit from a high breed of chicks at moderate prices.
The profit from this loan will be used for the education of her children and expanding her business. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest.

loans.use: To buy and sell firewood as well as engaging in poultry farming

loans.name: Federosi

texts.en:
Federosi is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Federosi has been working hard to manage her restaurant.

To help expand her business, Federosi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more fresh foods, such as raw bananas and beans, for sale. This will help Federosi to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her remaining children and provide her family's basic needs. Federosi hopes that in the future she will be able to complete construction of rental houses. 

Federosi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Federosi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy foods such as raw bananas and beans for sale.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
Zaman is from Iraq. He is 35 years old and single. Zaman lives with six family members, three of whom are employed. 

Zaman owns a small cafeteria. He established his business in 2010, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Zaman is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to make a display window and install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his café. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to make a display window and install an external ceiling and a rolling shutter for his café.

loans.name: Roxana Yanira

texts.es: Roxana Yanira de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Eduardo y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Roxana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica y con muchas metas por delante, su mas grande secreto para alcanzar el éxito es la constancia y el amor al trabajo sabe que solo así logrará lo que desea, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Roxana Yanira tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roxana Yanira is 36 years old and lives with her husband Eduardo and their son in their own home.  She owns a store in which she sells food such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other necessary items.  She has owned this business for many years and has gained great sales experience that has helped increase her income.  The store is located in her home in a very central part of town.  She has many regular customers that prefer to shop in her store because she always has the products they need at affordable prices, and she provides excellent service.

Roxana is very dedicated to her work, she is energetic, and she has many goals for the future.  Her secret of success is consistency and a love of the work.  With these two things, she believes that anyone can achieve what they desire.

As any good business owner, she wants to grow her business.  However, she needs capital in order to do so.  Therefore, she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that she can invest in the purchase of more basic grains, candies, eggs, bread, beverages, etc.  Roxana Yanira has great references and she is sure that she can repay the loan.  By growing her business, she is confident that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grains, candies, eggs, bread, and beverages.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 18-years-old and is single. Moustafa lives with 6 family members, of whom two are employed.
Moustafa owns a small shop selling mobiles. He established this business in 2012 and has an employee. He has built good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation. He is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 to pay the annual rental of his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 44 years old. She is not married and is blessed with three children.She runs a retail shop in the town of Tala. She has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES.19,000 per month. She has a very good credit history with  KADET LTD. She is applying for her seventh loan of KES.100,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to buy more stock for sale like maize flour, sugar, bread and detergent. She will use the extra profit to educate her children. She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy stock like maize flour, sugar, bread and detergent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayarjargal is a 41-year-old married man who lives with his two daughters, son, and wife in an outer ger district that lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  He is a teacher at a driving school.  

He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a car, which he plans to use for a transportation business in addition to his current job. His long term dream is to create a comfortable life for his family.

loans.use: to operate a transportation business.

loans.name: Salmah Group

texts.en:
This group is called Salmah Group. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen.
Hafithah, 22, is the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Hodeida, Yemen. She became the main source of her family's income when her husband became unable to take care of the family due to his illness. She has been selling perfume, incense, and clothes for two years now. 
To help her continue with her business operations, she has applied for a youth loan of 20,000 YER. She will use her portion of the group's loan to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marta Elizabeth

texts.es: Marta Elizabeth vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, pan, leche, huevos, azúcar, jabones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le  permite obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, es muy conocida en la localidad la gente la recomienda porque su tienda es muy surtida siempre tiene lo que la gente necesita a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y un servicio excelente; Marta  es una mujer dedicada a su labor, enérgica, y muy motivada a salir adelante, le gusta luchar por sus sueños sabe que si se esfuerza al máximo lograra lo que se propone y tendrá mucho éxito en su vida. Como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Marta Elizabeth tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía en que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Marta Elizabeth lives with her life partner and their children in her own house.  She has a store where she sells basic needs items like beans, rice, bread, milk, eggs, sugar, and soaps, among others.  She has had this business for several years.  It has gifted her with a lot of sales experience that allows her to always earn the best profits.

She is very well-known in the area.  People recommend her because her store is always well-stocked.  The store has what people need at affordable prices, quality products, and excellent service.

Marta is a woman who is devoted to her work, energetic, and very motivated to get ahead.  She likes to work hard to achieve her dreams.  She knows that if she puts forth maximum effort, she will achieve what she sets out to do, and she will be very successful in her life.

Like all good merchants, she wants to increase her business and make a new investment.  That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral.  She will use the loan to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, drinks, and soaps, etc.

Marta Elizabeth has good payment references and a high moral character.  She is certain that she will be able to repay the loan.  She is also confident that she will bring financial security to her household.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, bread, instant products, drinks, and soaps.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca cincuenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas de arroz y maíz, tiene varios años de experiencia en el negocio y eso le ha dado la oportunidad de obtener siempre las mejores ganancias, la pupusería esta ubicada en un lugar que califico como bueno para su trabajo ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque vende las pupusas mas ricas y calientitas de la zona además tiene los mejores precios, y el servicio mas rápido; Francisca es una mujer entregada a su labor, dispuesta a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus sueños, su mas grande secreto es la perseverancia sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital  por eso le solicita a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar  maíz, frijol, chicharrón, queso, verduras, bebidas etc. .  Francisca tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y  a la vez tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is a 58-year old woman who lives with her life partner and children. She works selling "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) made of rice and corn, and has several years of experience in the business, which has given her the opportunity to always obtain the highest profit. Her store or "pupusería" is well located and counts with many clients. People choose it over others because it sells the most delicious and warmest pupusas in the area, and offers the best price and fastest service. Francisca is very dedicated to her job, and is willing to give everything in her power to reach her dreams. Her biggest secret is her determination, which she knows will help her to be successful. 

Over the last few months, the demand has increased and she needs to make an additional investment. She doesn't have enough capital to invest, which is why she's requesting a loan to INTEGRAL to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, vegetables, beverages, etc. Francisco has good payment references and has committed to repay the loan. She also has faith she'll be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, pork rinds, cheese, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Wissam provides the family's only income.

Wissam owns a small shop where he sells all the required materials for dyeing cars. He established his business in 2005, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Wissam is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to install a rolling shutter for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his shop.

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat, pictured here holding the group's passbook, is a 42-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband and seven children in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family's needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business. His wife Nusrat is a member of a five-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods, like biscuits, sugar, rice, and chips, for his general store. This will help him meet his clients' needs and increase his savings to better his children's future.

Nusrat and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family. She is very much thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods for her husband's general store

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto de sesenta años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, él es un empleado de ordenanza en una institución tiene varios años con el trabajo y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia que le permite realizar su labor de una forma excelente y al mismo tiempo obtener su paga satisfactoriamente, es muy conocido en la localidad donde reside pues Benedicto se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad y por la capacidad de estar siempre al servicio de los demás;  es un hombre realmente entregado a su labor, dispuesto a dar todo de su parte para cumplir sus objetivos, lo mas impórtate en su vida es su pequeña familia y en las ultimas semanas el deterioro de su vivienda ha incomodado la tranquilidad del hogar, la casa necesita reparaciones y quiere realizarlas lo mas pronto posible para la seguridad de todos, su mas grande secreto es la constancia, sabe que así alcanzara el éxito, necesita invertir pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillos, tejas, cemento, polines  etc. Benedicto tiene buenas referencias de pago y se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda, a la vez tiene confianza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Benedicto is 60 years old and lives with his wife in their own home.  He works as an orderly in an institution and has done this work for many years.  He has gained valuable experience that has enabled him to both enjoy his work and also receive satisfactory pay.  He is well known in the town in which he resides.  He is characterized by his kindness and by his willingness to always be at the service of others.  He is devoted to his work and he gives his all to reach his goals.  The most important thing in his life is his small family and in the recent weeks, the deterioration of his home has disrupted the harmony in the household.

His home needs repairs and he wants to complete those repairs as quickly as possible for the safety of everyone.  He needs to invest in supplies for the repairs but does not have sufficient capital.  Therefore, he is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL so that he can buy bricks, tiling, cement, rafters, etc.  Benedicto has great references, he is very responsible, and he promises to repay the loan.  This will help him provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bricks, tiling, cement, and rafters.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and the father of three children, one of whom is employed.

Maher is a mechanic. He specializes in repairing cars and also in selling spare parts. He established his business in 1995, and now he has an employee. He built up experience in this field, and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Maher is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD to pay the yearly rent for his shop. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.

loans.use: to pay the yearly rent for his shop.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 41 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Shirley has had a shell crafting business in the Philippines for 13 years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nylon, string, and shells. 

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nylon, string, and shell.

loans.name: Charakhan

texts.en:
Charakhan is a 31-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and the mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Charakhan is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Charakhan has four years of experience in the home-based sewing business, making custom-ordered dresses and other small fabric household items. She is currently using an old sewing machine, which she would like to replace with a newer model to improve her speed and meet the orders of more customers. She would also like to make some small changes to her work area by painting it and adding some small furniture items to store her materials. 

To make these purchases, she is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2,500 USD.

Because of the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and make her work area nicer.

loans.name: Verah

texts.en:
Verah is a 27-year-old farmer in Kisii county, in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are schooling. She has been in farming for the past seven years, producing milk, eggs, beans, maize, bananas, and potatoes, which she sells at the local market in her area. 

She is requesting a KES 31,200 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow that will give her more milk produce, that will, in turn, generate extra income, that will help her improve her living standards and pay for her children's schooling. She aspires to have five dairy cows in the next five years.

Poor road networks, pests, and diseases are her major challenges in farming. Verah appreciates the way Juhudi Kilimo is fast in processing loans.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena is 39 years old, and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Bena has been working hard to manage her restaurant. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more raw and dry food such as bananas, beans, and maize flour.  This should help Bena generate greater profits, and pay school fees for her children and some of her relatives. 

Bena hopes that in the future, she will be able to start constructing a residential house. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Bena, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities for her restaurant.

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is 28 years old. He is married with one child. His wife is unemployed.

He has been in business for three years as a retail businessman, selling different items such as rice, sugar, and milk.  He has decided to get the loan to add more items in his retail store; with the profit, he will pay school fees for his wife.

loans.use: To buy more rice and milk to sell, in order to pay school fees for his wife.

loans.name: Tadamon Group

texts.en:
Hafidah is a 45-year-old mother who lives with her husband and 4 kids in Hodeida, Yemen. She is the leader of Tadamon Group. 

She has sold perfume, incense, clothes and makeup for the last four years, trying to help her husband with the family's daily expenses.

She and her group have applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. With her portion, she will buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and makeup. She hopes that this will boost her income.

She expects that one day she will be able to make her own incense

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and makeup for her business.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Bayarmaa is a 44-year-old widow who lives with her two sons, both of whom are students.  She works as a conductor for the local public transportation company. The family lives in a small house in an outer district of her city which lacks basic infrastructure. Her younger brother became engaged last autumn and has been living with his fiancee since last summer. Bayarmaa’s sister-in-law is student too, and she is requesting a 800,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to pay her sister-in-law’s tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her sister-in-law's tuition fees.

loans.name: Josiane

texts.en: Josiane is 34 years old. She is a widow with two children, the older of whom is 11 while the younger is 9. She has been in business for five years and is requesting this loan to buy more beans, ground nuts (or peanuts) and rice to sell to her customers. She will use the money she earns from this loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more beans, peanuts and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Carlos Ovidio

texts.es: Carlos, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad que se dedican a trabajar, la esposa de Carlos se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de forma ambulante y Carlos se dedica a trabajar en su propia carpintería, ambos son muy trabajadores y responsables. Carlos elabora diferentes artículos elaborados de madera como: roperos, muebles, mesas, sillas y otros más, realizando alguno por pedidos previos hechos por sus clientes y elaborando otros para vender en su negocio, lo que le deja ganancias extras de mucho beneficio. Carlos solicita un préstamo y de esta forma dar un paso más en su negocio, contando con más materia prima para elaborar su trabajo de manera que pueda aceptar más pedidos y así mismo elaborar más muebles para comercializar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two minor children. They both work: Carlos' wife is a street vendor selling fruit and vegetables, and Carlos has his own carpentry shop. They are both very hardworking and responsible. Carlos makes different items out of wood, such as closets, tables, chairs, and other funiture. Some of them he makes to fulfill a particular order from a customer, and others to sell at his shop, which brings in extra earnings and a high profit.

Carlos is requesting a loan so that he can move his business another step forward, by obtaining more raw material to do his work. This will allow him to accept more orders and also make more furniture to sell at his shop.

loans.use: to purchase wood and complete more carpentry work.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en: Eugene is 24 years old and single. He has been in the business of selling shirts and pants for the last six years. He is requesting this loan to buy more of these items to sell to his customers. Eugene plans to use the additional income he earns to buy a house.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and pants to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Charles works hard to support her family.

She has a business making and selling peanuts (salted and sugar coated) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig-fattening. Charles is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her peanuts.

Charles has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her peanuts.

loans.name: Shaheen's Group

texts.en:
Shaheen (shown holding a passbook) is the principal of a school that she founded a few years ago. She is an active and hard-working woman and lives in Rawalpindi with her husband and their son, who attends nursery school. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use her loan funds to invest in buying furniture, books, and stationery for her school. Her goal is to expand her school through this financing. She dreams of seeing her school succeed.

Shaheen is hopeful that the loan will be a productive investment for her and that it will bring positive changes in the life of her family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture, books and other stationery for her school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dressed chicken to offer for sale

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise, age 32, sells fruit to earn an income. She and her husband have a two-year-old child and a one-year-old baby. Her husband is a store owner. 

Louise has requested this loan in order to buy more fruit to offer for sale. 

She intends to use her profits to grow her savings.

loans.use: to buy fruit to offer for sale

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim, age 49, breeds cattle and sells them directly from his home to local butchers for meat purposes. He has more than 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him well how to look after cattle. He is also a taxi driver, but orders for this service are very rare. Karim and his wife have two children.
 
Karim usually buys calves, raises and fattens them over a period of five to six months, and resells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. This activity brings him 300 AZN income per month. The local people use beef in many everyday national dishes, such as as pilau and dolma, always served with yogurt sauce. Karim's son helps him in his work and is learning how to look after the livestock. 

This business provides the main financial income in his family, but at present it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children.
