Though it is still growing, I have managed to mentor and train students to attain skills and get jobs in the fields they've trained in.

I thank Ugafode for the good services it has made available to me since 2011 and its quick services whenever I'm in need.

May God bless you all." Erasmus

loans.use: To renovate the school structures

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is single and has 1 child. She has received no formal education. Abena sells provisions and the local dish Accra kenkey in Mpredwow, near Cape Coast. She has been doing this work for the past 3 years now. Abena uses her income to support her child. Abena will use the loan to purchase more provisions and maize for the sale of kenkey. With the profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest in her developing business.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions and maize for the sale of kenkey.

loans.name: Victoria Elizabeth

texts.es: Victoria siendo madre soltera de tres hijos quienes estudian, sola se ha esforzado trabajando para sacarlos adelante, antes laboraba como docente pero en la actualidad solamente vende cosméticos y ropa nueva negocio que le genera más ingresos el cual tiene varios años de haberlo iniciado donde poco a poco le ha venido invirtiendo con los prestamos, en esta ocasión necesita el crédito para comprar laminas de zinc y pelines para cambiar el techo de su casa y mejorar la infraestructura ya que esta se ve un poco deteriorada, su mayor objetivo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y tengan un mejor desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Victoria, being a single mother of three children who are all still in school, has put all her effort into working in order to get her children ahead. 

Before she worked as a teacher but at present she sells cosmetics and new clothing which generates more income for her. She has had this business for various years and has built it up little by little by investing loans. 

On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy zinc sheets and supports in order to replace the roof of her house and improve the infrastructure as it is a little deteriorated. Her main goal is that her children finish their studies and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy zinc and supports for her roof.

loans.name: Aqshin

texts.en:
Aqshin is 25 years old. He is married and has one son. He sells seasonal fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates, and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU, Aqshin was able to start his own business.  He has 3 years of experience and the reason to start his business was poverty and failure to find a permanent job. 
 
Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during the year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. He sells crops from his house and people passing by always buy fresh fruit. His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN. 

Aqshin wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. He would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase his turnover as well as to improve life for his family. For this purpose he applied for 1500 AZN loan. This will be his second loan and Aqshin has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is a 48-year-old woman, a widow, bringing up one daughter, alone. She breeds sheep and cattle for meat purposes, for local butchers. Dilshad has ten years of experience in this field, thanks to her husband, who taught her the best way to look after cattle. 

Dilshad usually buys small cattle and sheep, raises and fattens them for five or six months, and resells them for a more profitable price in the local livestock bazaar.  

Meat-selling brings AZN 120 income per month. Beef and mutton are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt souse. Also, Dilshad sells sheep's wool which is useful for clothes and blankets. 
  
Dilshad applied for a loan of AZN 1000 to purchase one cattle and five sheep. This will be her second loan and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one cattle and five sheep.

loans.name: Solmaz

texts.en:
Solmaz is a 61-year-old woman on a pension. She is married and has four children. She sells watermelons and melons, as well as seasonal fruits such as pears, oranges, apples, pomegranates and bananas. With the help of AqroInvest CU, Solmaz was able to start her own business.  She has 10 years of experience and the reasons to start her business were the low living conditions and low pension.  

Fruits are very popular among Azerbaijan people and in high demand during year.  People like to eat it fresh and this is one of the main desserts for guests. She sells crops from her house and people that pass by always buy some fresh fruit. Her monthly income from this business is 150 AZN. Solmaz's husband helps her to sell fruit.

Solmaz wants to expand her business. The amount of products she sells is not enough to cover the high demand. She would like to purchase more fruits and vegetables and increase her turnover as well as to improve her family's life. For this purpose she has applied for 1500 AZN loan. This will be her third loan and Solmaz has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Diappo 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe de crédit Diappo 5 regroupe cinq personnes qui habitent le même quartier et qui ce sont regroupés en groupe de crédit pour améliorer  leur activités génératrices de revenus. Dans le groupe, les activités sont variées, car y a en qui font du commerce, d’autres de la restauration, d’autres encore de la couture. La présidente, madame Aida est une dame qui fait de la vente de produits alimentaires : du sucre, du lait, des biscuits… et cela depuis 6 ans maintenant. Sur la photo, elle a levé la main. Elle gère sa petite famille et leurs dépenses quotidiennes. Elle travaille pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille c’est son plus grand soucis.
texts.en:
The Diappo 5 Group is made up of five people who live in the same district. They have come together to form a lending group in order to improve their businesses. The businesses represented in the group are varied, with some members who are merchants, others who have restaurants, and still others who are seamstresses.

The president of the Diappo 5 Group is named Aida. She has been a food merchant for the past six years. Her products include sugar, milk, and biscuits, among other goods. Aida is shown in the photo with her hand raised. She manages her family and their daily expenses. Aida is working to improve the life of her family, which is her biggest concern.

loans.use: to purchase food products for resale (including sugar, milk, and biscuits)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ceramic tile, cement, and fine porcelain to lay a floor

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: La Sra. Fortunata  tiene 28 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de un año, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de jugos de naranja, mandarina  y de toronja  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Fortunata  va a usar este préstamo para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, ya que esta le ayuda a transportar las frutas que compra al por mayor para la elaboración de sus jugos,   su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo,  La Sra. Fortunata  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Fortunata is 28 years old and has a one-year-old son.  She sells a variety of juices made from oranges, tangerines and grapefruits from her stall in the zone of Los Andes.  This is her first loan from this institution.  She will use the funds for the maintenance of her vehicle, since this helps her to transport the fruits that she buys at wholesale.  She currently lacks cash and thus is seeking a loan.  

She is a very hardworking person and is grateful for this opportunity, as her business is her only means of sustenance.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 20 лет. Разведена, живет с матерью и сыном. Сын взрослый, ездит на работу в соседний город, но также помогает матери с теплицами.

Лариса выращивают помидоры, редис и огурцы. Для получения раннего урожая, а также сохранения урожая в холодные зимы нужно делать отопление в теплицах. Лариса уже приобрела котел для отопления, теперь ей нужны трубы,шланги и уголь. Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит 17,000 гривен, чтобы закончить систему отопления. 

Лариса трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная. У нее есть еще земля, которая пока что пустует. Лариса планирует ставить дополнительные теплицы и развивать свой бизнес дальше.
texts.en:
Larisa has been growing vegetables for twenty years. She is divorced and lives with her mother and son. Her son is an adult who works in a nearby town and also helps his mother with the greenhouses. 

Larisa grows tomatoes, radishes and cucumbers. In order to reap an early crop, as well as to preserve the harvest in the cold of winter, the greenhouses must be heated.  Larisa has already acquired a boiler for heating, but now she needs pipes, hoses and charcoal. Larisa is asking for a loan of 17,000 hryvnia to complete the heating system. 

Larisa is hardworking and cheerful. She has more land which, so far, is undeveloped. Larisa plans to build additional greenhouses and grow her business further.

loans.use: install heating systems in her greenhouses.

loans.name: Xalis

texts.en:
Xalis is a 43-year-old man, who runs a private business. He is married and has two children. His primary activity is selling food products. He is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods such as yogurt, sausages, candies, cookies, and macaroni for the last 8 years. He is financially responsible for his parents and children. 

His shop is located in the central bazaar which is why his products sell very fast. His business brings in a stable income of 170 AZN and his brother helps to sell products from the shop. He would like to increase his income and for this purpose he applied for 1000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his second loan and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in the market

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga is s 46-year-old woman, married, and has 4 children. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods such as cookies, macaroni, ketchup, tea, and candies. She has 15 years of experience in this field which makes her an experienced vendor. Her shop is located in the central bazaar, which makes her business successful, because a lot of people visit the bazaar during the day.

Her monthly income is 120 AZN, which is not enough to cover the needs of her beloved children. Her husband is a builder and his salary is not permanent. To improve their financial situation Shalala decided to improve her business first. She applied for 2000 AZN loan to purchase a variety of food products. This will be her second loan and she has a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more food products to sell at the market.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz is a 27-year-old man who runs a private business. He is married and has one son.  His primary activity is selling food products. He is a market vendor and has been selling different kinds of goods such as yoghurt, sausages, candies, cookies and macaronis for the last 8 years. 

His business brings him a stable income of 150 AZN, and his older son helps to sell products at the shop. He would like to increase his income and for this purpose, he applied for a 1,500 AZN loan. He will use this loan to diversify and purchase more products for his shop. This will be his second loan, and he has a good loan history.

loans.use: To buy more food products

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hana is a 32-year-old, married woman from Gaza. She has three children: one son and two daughters. 

The only income the family has is from the taxi. Hana's husband is a taxi driver. This taxi has been working for the past six years and now it needs a lot of repairing, like painting and maintenance. These repairs cost a lot and the family can't afford them all at one time. 

Hana took a USD 1,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help the family to renew the taxi and improve its condition. Hana appears in the photo.

loans.use: to repair and paint the taxi her husband drives.

loans.name: Adeeb

texts.en:
Adeeb is a 38-year-old married man and a father to two sons. Adeeb is well-known as a very active hard worker. He works as a folkloric band trainer and also he works in an association for workers' rights.

He seeks to improve the family situation so he is building a new house. Adeeb's house still needs some construction supplies, but because of the low income he earns, he can't afford all these costs.

Adeeb took a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting the house and installing tiles. This loan will help Adeeb to complete the family's house and provide his family with better living conditions.

He appears in the photo.

loans.use: To pay for construction supplies to finish the family home.

loans.name: Vaimalo

texts.en: Vaimalo is a 37-year-old married woman with six children. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. Vaimalo has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives and a spade etc. Vaimalo will spend her profits on extending her business.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives and a spade.

loans.name: Ernesto Jose

texts.es: Ernesto de 30 años esposa es ama de casa no ha podido encontrar empleo, tienen tres hijos, el tiene que trabajar mucho para poderles ofrecer a ellos una vida digna y que puedan estudiar solamente con su salario a veces, trabaja en una empresa de café y sus mayores deseos son seguir mejorando su casa, este crédito lo invertirá en la instalación de servicios higiénicos, comprara inodoro, arena, cemento para así vivir en mejores condiciones y sobre todo mejor presentación,  poco a poco ha ido mejorando la infraestructura con créditos otorgados por Afodenic con fondos Kiva por lo que está muy contento por este apoyo tan importante .
texts.en:
Ernesto is 30 years old.  His wife is a homemaker; she hasn't been able to find work.  They have three children.  He has to work a lot, only on his salary sometimes, so he can give them a decent life and they can study.  He works in a coffee company and his biggest desire is to continue improving his house.

He's going to use this loan to install a bathroom.  He'll buy a toilet, sand, and cement so they can have better living conditions and especially so it will look better.

Little by little he has been improving the infrastructure with loans from AFODENIC through Kiva funds.  He's very happy about this important support.

loans.use: to buy a toilet, sand, and cement for a bathroom

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is 55 years old and married with 5 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, yams, and taamu that she sells in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 2 years. Mareta needs a loan to buy weed spray, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for the plantation and pay for her children's school fees. She has been a member of SPBD since 2007. Mareta will use the profits from her sales to expand her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy weed spray, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and a crowbar for the plantation

loans.name: Ayob

texts.en:
Ayob is a 37-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and one daughter. He lives with his family in Jabalia, in modest living conditions. Ayob is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his family's needs.

For the past three years, Ayob has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable business and a second source of income to the family.

Ayob is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the costs of repairing the taxi he drives, such as installing new wheels and painting the body. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and enable Ayob to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income. Ayob is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair his taxi.

loans.name: Inaydina

texts.es:
Inaydina es una joven de 20 años muy abnegada, comparte una vida conyugal con Fredy de 25 años y para complemento de la alegría familiar esta su pequeño Ángelo de 2 añitos, comparten actualmente sus vivencias familiares en una casa construida a base de madera que le cedieron sus padres. Al sentir que las actividades agropecuarias eran muy rigorosas para ella, opto por iniciarse en la venta de ropa para damas y niños desde hace 5 meses con el apoyo económico de Fredy. A pesar de algunas dificultades el negocio tuvo buena acogida inicialmente entre sus vecinos y posteriormente dirigiéndose en los domicilios aledaños a su negocio para ofrecer sus prendas.
Con la compañía de su pequeño desarrolla su labor de vendedora con mucho entusiasmo puesto que siempre fue de su agrado y siente tener vocación para las ventas.
Dentro de los inconvenientes que posee son el pago atrasado que generan algunas clientas a quienes entrega su mercadería en calidad de fiado generándole inconvenientes a la hora de cuadrar sus ganancias.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a seguir trabajando con el entusiasmo que la caracteriza para cumplir uno de sus objetivos a largo plazo que es aperturar un negocio mas grande dedicado a la venta de ropas de diversos tipos. Actualmente desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles con los cuales adquirir mercadería para surtir su negocio con prendas de vestir para damas consistentes en pantalones y polos de moda.
texts.en:
Inaydina is a selfless 20 year-old youth who shares married life with Fredy, who is 25.  Completing this happy family is their small son Angelo, who is 2 years old.  They currently share their family experiences in a home made of wood that was given to them by their parents.  Feeling that agricultural activities would be too rigorous for her, she chose to start a business selling clothing for women and children.  She started the business 5 months ago with the financial support of Fredy.  In spite of some difficulties, the business was well accepted from the start by her neighbors, and later she started going out to homes in the surrounding areas to offer her garments for sale.

She's been developing her business with a lot of enthusiasm in the company of her little one.  This line of work has always been to her liking, and she feels she has a vocation for sales.

Among the problems she faces are the late payments she receives from some of her customers, to whom she has delivered merchandise on credit.  This creates problems for her when she goes to balance her accounts.

For the future, she plans to continue to work with the enthusiasm she is known for so that she can achieve one of her long term goals: to open a much bigger business where she could sell all types of clothing.  At this time, she requests 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy merchandise to stock her business with ladies clothing, specifically pants and fashionable tops.

loans.use: to buy pants and fashionable tops

loans.name: Faataitaia

texts.en:
Faataitaia is a 21-year-old married woman with one child. She would like to start growing taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. Faataitaia has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack, spray, an axe, a spade and a file.

Faataitaia will spend her profits to save for her child's school fees.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, a file and a crowbar for the plantation.

loans.name: Plan De Lucha 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is one of the members of the Plan de Lucha (Battle Plan) Group 2 & 3, located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. Her business is in "Fruits and Vegetables." Ramona is a married woman. She tells us that her biggest challenge is to thrive--to have a successful business and a stable life.

Ramona is very excited to receive her second loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan. This was a step toward making her business grow. She has had her business for about seven years. She started it with her own savings, selling fruits, vegetables, and other goods.

Ramona plans to use this new loan to purchase oranges, grapefruit, bananas, potatoes, and other fruits and vegetables. She is planning to increase the quantity of her inventory. She plans to use her earnings to invest in her house. Her dream is to build her house. She thanks all of you for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Mahmoud appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sara is a 20-year-old young woman. She is married to Mahmoud and a mother to one son. Sara's husband is employed and makes a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his family's needs.

For the past three years, Sara's husband has also been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project but also needs more support to cover the family's needs.

Sara is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Nadhira

texts.en:
Nadhira lives in Taiz, Yemen. She is a 34-year-old married woman and has two children.

She has been selling cosmetic materials and needs to enlarge her business. So, she applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetic materials for her business. 

She hopes to open a perfume  and cosmetic materials store in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic materials for her business.

loans.name: Asrar Group

texts.en:
The Asrar group consists of four females from Hodeidah-Yemen,  Amal, 27 years old, had to leave school in order to help her family, which was in financial difficulty as a result of her father's retirement and severe illness. She has started her job making homemade Henna items like mixing of perfumes and creams which is used for wedding of brides. She sells it to retailers, customers and door to door.
Any shortages of her product items will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a youth loan to buy the required Henna items to continue forward with her business.
Ibtisam, Khlod and Samirah are hoping to earn a good income, which will allow them to improve their families' quality of life family.

loans.use: to buy Henna cosmetic items to continue forward with her business.

loans.name: Byan Group

texts.en: The Byan group is located in Hodeidah,Yemen, and consists of 5 women. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. Sadah is 29 years old and the mother of three lovely children. She has been operating a business of selling perfumes, incense and food. She is a helpful woman who works to assist her husband cover their household expenses. They live under a difficult situation due to the expensive values of inventories. So, she requested a youth loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy perfumes, incense and food to increase her income. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and food to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for her grocery selling business.

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
Toribia de 52 años vive separada del padre de sus 2 hijos. El mayor de ellos ya es independiente y Toribia vive su hija menor de 17 años y su anciana madre, en una casa propia ubicada en la ciudad. Toribia es una mujer como pocas, trabaja desde las 4 de la mañana. Se esfuerza mucho en su actividad principal que es la venta de alimentos en su restaurante.
Lleva más de un año en esta labor y considera que es rentable. “Preparo desayunos y almuerzos, y en todo este tiempo he conocido clientes que se  hicieron mis amigos”, menciona.
Su rutina es cansada, todos los días debe iniciar su actividad en la madrugada para preparar los desayunos, y después de atender a los clientes debe preparar los almuerzos. En las tardes tiene que realizar la limpieza e ir al mercado para hacer las compras de la mercadería para el día siguiente.
Este año, ella vio que la clientela está fidelizada por ello continúa con su actividad. Requiere de su apoyo para adquirir más mercadería y así brindar un mejor servicio a los comensales. Éste es su crédito número 2 con MFP. Agradece la reiterada confianza, por su parte menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos que expende en su local de ventas.
texts.en:
Toribia is 52 years old and is separated from the father of her two children. The oldest of these is already independent, and Toribia lives with her youngest child, aged 17, and her mother, who is very old. They live in their own home in the city.

Toribia is a special woman, starting work at 4 o'clock in the morning. She works very hard in her main job, selling food in her restaurant. She has been doing this for over a year, and believes it is profitable. "I prepare breakfasts and lunches, and throughout this time I've met customers who have become my friends", she says.

Her routine is exhausting. Every day she has to begin work in the early morning preparing breakfast, and after serving customers she has to prepare lunch. In the afternoon she has to do the cleaning and go to the market to buy ingredients for the following day.

This year, she saw that her customers had become loyal to her, and this is why she continues in this work. She needs your support to buy more goods so she can offer diners a better service. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the continued trust placed in her. She says that she will make her monthly loan repayments on time. She will invest the money in buying ingredients to prepare the food she sells in her business.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients to prepare the food she sells in her  business.

loans.name: Afioae

texts.en: Afioae is 23 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small garden where she grows cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes and taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Afioae needs a loan to buy new equipment. Afioae will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, a file and a spade.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en: Repeka is 53 years old and married with 7 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, tomatoes, beans and cucumbers that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Repeka needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for the plantation. She will use her profits to improve her family assets.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for the plantation.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Sana is a 23-year-old young married woman and a mother to two daughters. Her husband is a construction worker, which is a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but it also needs more support to cover the necessary costs of improving the project.

Sana is requesting a 1,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help her husband cover the cost of purchasing a new construction kit. This will improve Sana's husband's work, which will create a good reputation among customers for him, which will then increase the family's income and offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a new construction kit

loans.name: Vala

texts.en: Vala is 36 years old and married with 9 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Vala needs a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack, spray, knives, filings and a spade. Vala will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and a crowbar for the plantation.

loans.name: Faataitai

texts.en: Faataitai is a 36-year-old married woman with 2 children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, bananas and yams to earn a living. Faataitai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, an axe, knives, a knapsack, spray, etc. She will use her profits to cover her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, an axe, knives, a knapsack, spray, etc.

loans.name: Fiapai

texts.en: Fiapai is a 30-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. Fiapai has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a knapsack, spray, bush knives, a spade, etc. With her profits, Fiapai hopes to save her profits for her children's school.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives and a spade.

loans.name: Sifiti

texts.en: Sifiti is a 24-year-old married woman with 3 children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, yams and bananas to earn a living. Sifiti has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a spade, etc. for her plantation. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Sifiti will spend her profits to save for her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, a spade, etc.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel de 23 años es un joven con mucha disciplina laboral, soltera y con la responsabilidad de brindarles a sus padres el apoyo por su avanzada edad tiene el compromiso de trabajo y progreso. Habita una vivienda construida a base de adobe que le cedieron sus padres. Culminado el colegio su padre cayo muy delicado de salud motivo por el cual no tuvo la oportunidad de proseguir estudios superiores, no obstante comprometido con el trabajo en el campo desde muy joven decidió incursionar de manera independiente para apoyar a su familia económicamente. Actualmente labora en las parcelas de sus padres cultivando cacao orgánico con el cual se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo por ser muy rentable. A manera de proseguir con la respectiva campaña productiva debe de estar al pendiente de las plantaciones para el cual cuenta con el firme apoyo de jornaleros con quienes labora en conjunto en las distintas tareas como el deshierbo, injertado de plantas y la inserción de abono orgánico.
Tiene en mente a manera de prueba realizar la inserción de plantas de achiote para el cual se encuentra destinando un terreno adecuado.
Tiene el deseo de al formalizar un relación conyugal aperturar un negocio consistente en una juguería fuente de soda para así paralelo a sus actividades en el campo buscar un sólido ingresos para la economía de su futura familia. Actualmente requiere contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la contrata de jornaleros quienes realizaran tareas de deshierbo y abonado de sus plantaciones de cacao con guano de isla.
texts.en: Joel is a 23-year-old single man who has a great deal of discipline and a good work ethic. He has taken on the responsibility of supporting his elderly parents. He lives in an adobe home that his parents have passed on to him. Upon finishing school, his father became quite ill, and for this reason Joel was not able to pursue a university education. Nevertheless, having worked hard in the fields since he was very young, he decided to work independently in order to support his family economically. He currently works in his parents' fields growing organic cacao. He feels this is very promising as this crop is highly profitable. In his work he relies on the support of day laborers who work on different tasks, such as pulling weeds, grafting plants, and applying compost. He also has a plan to test grow achiote plants on suitable land. He wishes to get married and open a business selling juices and soft drinks in parallel with his farming activities so that he can achieve solid income to support his family economically. He currently needs 2,000 nuevos soles in order to hire day laborers to pull weeds and apply compost to his crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: La Sra. Magali tiene 33 años y tiene un hijo de la edad de 6 años, la Sra. Magali es de ocupación carpintera trabaja junto a su esposo quien también es carpintero y quien le enseño este oficio tiene su propio taller ubicado en la comunidad de San Basilio,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de madera al por mayor ya que tiene que realizar entregas de muebles  la Sra. Magali es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado ya que ella está orgullosa de trabajar ya que este oficio generalmente es de varones y ella salió adelante y se siente feliz porque traspaso estas barreras que lo logro a base de mucha perseverancia.
texts.en: Magali, 33, has a six-year-old son; she’s a carpenter by profession and works alongside her husband who is also a carpenter and who taught her the occupation.  She has her own shop located in the community of San Basilio.  The loan will be used to buy lumber at wholesale because she has some pending furniture orders.  Magali is a very hardworking person who feels grateful to the institution for the support provided her because she’s proud to work in this occupation that is usually reserved for men and she’s gotten ahead and feels happy because she crossed the barriers thanks to her perseverance.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia de 33 años comparte un matrimonio sólido con Víctor de 35 años quien junto a sus 4 hijos cumplen su rol de padres con bastante esmero. Es propietaria de una vivienda de madera adquirida poco después de su matrimonio. Desde niña fue instruida junto a sus padres en las distintas actividades agrícolas referentes a la producción de cacao orgánico, tiempo después de conocer a Víctor optaron por adquirir unas parcelas para el sustento de su joven familia de aquel entonces.
Llevan 17 años como productores independientes y comenta que le va muy bien en cuanto a sus plantaciones, no obstante la época de lluvias es para ellos un inconveniente puesto que sus parcelas poseedoras de plantaciones de cacao se encuentran en un terreno algo inclinado y hacen un poco complicada sus labores cotidianas.
Para proseguir de manera fluida con la campaña cacaotera desean reemplazar algunas plantaciones desfasadas y proceder con la inserción de injertos esperando sacarle el máximo provecho a sus parcelas.
Sus planes a futuro apuntan a la culminación de su vivienda a base de material noble para el bienestar de sus pequeños  así como la apertura de un negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes para generar ingresos paralelo a sus actividades agropecuarias. Requiere contar actualmente con 4,000 nuevos soles para adquirir sacos de abono guano de isla, compra de plantas almácigo o cacao y el pago de los jornaleros quienes agilizarán el trabajo de injertado en los árboles desfasados.
texts.en:
Julia, 33, shares a strong marriage with Víctor, 35; they fulfill their role as parents of their four children with much dedication.  She owns a wood house that she acquired shortly after she got married.  Since she was a girl, her parents taught her various agricultural activities related to growing organic cocoa beans.  Shortly after meeting Víctor they opted for acquiring some parcels of their own to support their young family back then.

They’ve been working as independent growers now for 17 years and she comments that she does quite well with respect to her crops.  The rainy season, however, is inconvenient for them because their fields planted with cocoa beans are at a slight incline and their daily chores become a bit complicated.

To continue in a streamlined way with the cocoa bean growing process, they want to replace some of the plants that have outgrown their useful cycle and insert grafts hoping to get the best possible results from their parcels.

Her future plan is focused on finishing building her house with substantial materials for the comfort of her little ones as well as to open a grocery store to generate income additional to that produced by the agricultural activities.  She needs to have 4,000 new soles now to buy sacks of island guano fertilizer and to buy cocoa bean seedlings and to pay labor costs for the laborers who will do the work of grafting onto the old trees.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plant seedlings and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Tuli

texts.en: Tuli is 35 years old and married with 1 child. She has a small garden where she grows taro, bananas and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Tuli needs a loan to buy knives, chemicals, a file, a spade, a wheelbarrow, etc. for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. Tuli will use the profits from her sales to extend her business.

loans.use: to buy knives, chemicals, a file, a spade, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de vidrios en su vidriería que se encuentra en un lugar estratégico, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la ampliación de de su negocio, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de vidrios para surtir su negocio, ya que desea brindar variedad de productos a su clientela.
texts.en: Ronald continues with the same activity selling glass in his strategically located glazier shop.  He relates that he did very well with his previous loan since he used it to expand the business.  On this occasion, he’s requesting the loan to buy a variety of glass to stock his business since he wants to offer a good variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy glass at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 37-year-old married man and a father of one child. He has been operating his own variety store for 15 years now; he sells accessories, perfumes, toys, and gifts. Jihad previously took a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and he was very satisfied with the credit, especially its amount. 

Currently, Jihad is applying for a second loan. He will invest the money in buying new merchandise, mostly accessories and gifts. With this, Jihad will be able to serve the increasing demand of his customers. In the future, he is planning to further diversify his store and attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise, mostly accessories and gifts.

loans.name: La Finquita Group

texts.es:
La finquita es un grupo solidario conformado por 4 personas que buscan mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias a base de un trabajo honesto y responsable, siendo una motivación para ello sus hijos la razón de seguir adelante.
 De este grupo se destaca la Sra. Blanca por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Blanca vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en Latacunga. Blanca trabaja con en la crianza de ganado para venta, actualmente le va muy bien en su negocio ya que tiene buena clientela.
Blanca solicita un crédito a FODEMI el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de una vaca lechera para entrar en el negocio de producción y venta de leche y queso, negocio que les ayudará a obtener más clientes, mejorar las ventas y un incremento en los ingresos lo que ayudará a mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Blanca sueña en tener una producción grande de leche para poder ser una distribuidora y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
“La Finiquita” is a mutually supportive group of four people who are seeking to improve their and their families’ quality of life by means of their honest, responsible work.  Their children are their motivation to continue forward.

Blanca stands out from the group for being a responsible, hardworking person who very much wants to self-improve.  Blanca lives with her husband and three children in Latacunga.  Blanca works raising cattle to sell and does quite well in her business because she has a good clientele.

Blanca is asking FODEMI for a loan to buy a dairy cow to start a milk and cheese business, a business that will help her acquire more customers, improve sales and increase income which will help improve quality of life.  Blanca dreams with being a large dairy farmer to become a distributor and improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Larry José

texts.es:
Larry es un joven de 28 años de edad originario de una comunidad que lleva por nombre Chaguitillo a unos 5 km de la ciudad de  Sebaco, esta ciudad está en la parte norte de Nicaragua, estado civil soltero no tiene hijo convive con su mamá y demás hermanos.

Actualmente Larry se desempeña como inspector lector de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado con antigüedad laboral de tres años en cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta y de buenos valores morales.

Con el crédito que solicita a ceprodel  lo destinara para complementar al compra de una motocicleta ya que el cuanta con una buena parte de dinero para realizar dicha compra.

El joven Larry espera apoyo ya que la motocicleta le será de mucha importancia ya que será el medio de transporte que utilizara para viajar a su trabajo el cual esta distante de su lugar de origen.
texts.en:
Larry is 28 years old. He is originally from the Chaguitillo community about 5 km from the city of Sebaco. This city is in the northern part of Nicaragua. He is not married and has no children. He lives with his mother and other siblings. 

Currently, Larry is a reader inspector for a water supply and sewage company. He has worked there for three years and has proven to be a responsible and honest person with good moral values.

With the loan he is requesting from CEPRODEL, he will put it towards buying a motorcycle, since it will take that amount and additional money to make the purchase.

Larry hopes for the support since the motorcycle will be very important. It will be his transportation to work, which is far from his home.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Erlan  Geovany

texts.es:
Erlan es originario de la ciudad de Matagalpa ubicada geográficamente en la parte norte de Nicaragua, su estado civil es soltero tiene una edad de 24 años no tiene hijos. Es un joven responsable, honesto y presenta buena conducta moral.

 Actualmente se desempeña como bodeguero lector de una empresa de servicio de acueducto y alcantarillado, con más de dos años de estar laborando en esta empresa.

 Con los ingreso obtenido en su trabajo el aporta para los gastos del hogar ya que convive con su progenitora y hermanos.

solicita un crédito a ceprodel para pago de  gastos universitario ya que actualmente está cursando los estudios superiores.
texts.en: Erlan is from the city of Matagalpa geographically located in northern Nicaragua.  He’s single and 24-year-old; he has no children.  He’s a responsible, honest young man with good moral principles.  He currently works as a warehouse man for a plumbing firm; he’s been working for that firm for more than two years.  He’s able to contribute to household expenses with his salary; he lives with his mother and siblings.  He’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to pay his university expenses since he’s currently enrolled in higher education.

loans.use: to pay tuition and monthly fees.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de productos de su primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de abarrotes, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de variedad de mercadería como refrescos, galletas, etc.  para surtir su negocio, ya que desea brindar variedad de productos a su clientela.
texts.en: Rosmery continues with her same activity selling basic staple items in her neighborhood store.  She relates that she did very well with her previous loan since she used it to buy grocery items.  On this occasion, she requests the loan to buy a variety of merchandise like soft-drinks, cookies, etc. to stock her store because she wants to provide variety of products to her clientele.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Nizam

texts.en:
Nizam is from Iraq. She is 46 years old, married, and has five children. Nizam and her husband provide the family income.

Nizam owns a small shop and specializes in selling sweets and pastries. She established her business in 2009. She built a good experience in this field and she is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Nizam is requesting a loan of USD 2,800 to buy some equipment, specialized for preparing pastries; to make new shelves for her shop; and to increase her inventory. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits, so she will be able to provide her family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy some equipment, specialized for preparing pastries; make new shelves for her shop; and to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 22 years old, single, and lives with four family members, one of whom one is employed.

Abdullah owns a big generator and he provides his neighborhood with electricity. He established his business in 2010. He built a good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Abdullah is requesting a youth loan of USD 1,800 to buy equipment for his generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his generator.

loans.name: Omm Alrahman Group

texts.en: The Omm Alrahman Group includes five ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Fateima is a 29-year-old mother of four children. She has been selling vegetables for four years trying to help her husband financially and improve her family's quality of life. She has applied for a youth loan to have a second venture, buying perfumes and incense along with the vegetables.

loans.use: to buy some perfumes and incense alongside with vegetables.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es viuda hace 23 años, vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos de 35 y 26 años de edad quienes la acompañan y apoyan, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Dina es la venta de periódicos. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano, en las madrugadas y se dirige a la imprenta donde compra sus periódicos. Todo lo que obtiene los lleva a puesto de ventas ubicado en un mercado conocido de la localidad, en algunas ocasiones vende de manera ambulatoria caminando por las calles de la ciudad. Lleva realizando éste oficio desde hace 22 años y logró hacerse conocida por lo que tiene una cantidad considerable de clientes quienes la esperan por su periódico diario. Ocasionalmente recibe el apoyo de su hijo en la venta pero por lo general trabaja sola. Le gusta su negocio pues con eso ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y mantenerlos a lo largo de su juventud, aprendiendo esta labor gracias a la motivación que le brindaba una vecina y viendo las ganancias que le deja decidió continuar siendo ahora su principal oficio. Espera seguir adelante y conseguir ahorrar el dinero necesario para llevar una vejez tranquila. Este es el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, por tanto agradece el apoyo que le brindan para acceder al crédito y continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente contenta con los integrantes de su banco comunal pues los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de periódicos de manera progresiva.
texts.en:
Dina, 59, is a very hardworking, dedicated woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She’s been a widow for the last 23 years.  She lives with her two children who are 35 and 26 years of age and who keep her company and support her; she lives in her own house.  

Dina’s activity is selling newspapers.  She rises very early every day and at dawn heads to the print shop where she buys her newspapers.  Everything she gets she takes to her sales stand located in a well-known, local market.  Sometimes she sells from place to place wandering through the city streets.  She’s been in this business for 22 years and has become well-known so she has a considerable number of customers that buy their newspapers from her every day.  Her son sometimes helps her sell but she usually works alone.  She likes her business because she’s been able to raise her children by means of it and to support them throughout their youth.  She learned this activity thanks to the encouragement she got from a neighbor and seeing the profits she netted she decided to continue with; it’s her main source of work.

She hopes to continue forward and to save money that will take her through a worry-free old age.  This is MFP loan #11 so she’s grateful for the support provided to access credit and continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she feels happy with the members of her communal bank because she considers them to be responsible, mutually supportive people.  She will use the requested 3,000 new soles to buy newspapers progressively.

loans.use: to buy newspapers.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima, 25 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 1 hijo, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Fátima es cliente Kiva su primer crédito lo utilizo  para comprar unas pacas de ropa  usada y nueva,  asi ofrecer a sus clientes mas variedad, espera crecer en su negocio y mejorar las ganancias para poder tener mas ingreso y de esta manera invertir mas en su pulpería
Ella  ahora requiere de su segundo crédito al igual para invertir en la venta de ropa. Todos los productos necesarios para surtir aun más el inventario de su negocio. Ella estima que este préstamo le será de gran ayuda ya que aumentaran sus ventas generándole más ganancias que  invertirá en su negocio y en la mejora de su vivienda. Sus planes futuros es ampliar su negocio,y  que le genere  mejores ingresos y salir adelante con su familia
texts.en:
Fátima, 25, is from Granada.  She’s the mother of one son and she’s a merchant by occupation.  She sells groceries.  Fátima is a Kiva client and she used her first loan to buy some bales of used and new clothes to offer her customers more variety.  She hopes to grow in business and improve profits to have more income and be able to invest more in her grocery store.

She now needs a second loan that she’ll invest in clothes like the last time.  All are products needed to stock her business’ inventory still more.  She feels that this loan will be of great use to her because her sales will increase generating higher profits that she’ll reinvest in her business and use to do home improvements.  Her future plan is to expand the business and that it generates higher income so she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
Lastenia, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar, está casada con Simón, quien es empleado, vive en compañía de su esposo y su hija de 27 años de edad, habitando su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Lastenia es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceite, fideos, atunes y otros. Para eso cuenta con una bodega la cual está instalada en su casa, desde ahí atiende ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes que son por lo general sus propios vecinos, atiende a todos de manera amable y cordial a lo largo de los 5 años que viene trabajando en su bodega. Realiza esta actividad sola y en ocasiones con el apoyo de su  esposo cuando tiene ratos libres.
Le  gusta su trabajo pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su hogar, así como los ingresos económicos que le genera para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Por lo contario, lo que no le gusta es cuando algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos concedidos, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajado con las mismas ganas, ahora tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este es el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, Por ello espera agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además, se siente a gusto trabajando con su banco comunal pues le agrada el trabajo que viene realizando sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de más abarrotes como pan, arroz, azúcar, huevos, leche y aceite buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en:
Lastenia, 47, is a hardworking, enterprising woman who very much wants to make progress.  She’s married to Simón who is employed.  She lives with her husband and 27-year-old daughter in her own house.

Lastenia’s activity is selling basic staple grocery items like rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oil, noodles, tuna and others.  To do so, she has a home-based grocery store.  She tends to her customers there offering products.  Her customers for the most part are her very neighbors.  She has taken care of all of them graciously and kindly for the entire five years her store has been in operation.  She works alone with the occasional help from her husband when he has free time.

She likes her work because it allows her to stay in the comfort of her home and the income it generates helps her husband cover household expenses.  On the other hand, she doesn’t much like when some of her customers lag behind making payments when credit has been extended to them but she does not let that discourage her and she continues working with the same dedication.  Now, she plans to continue with her work and to make it grow.

This is MFP loan # 11 and she’s grateful for the opportunity she’s being given to make her plans reality.  Also, she feels comfortable working with her communal bank because she likes the work the members do.

She will use the requested 2,000 new soles to buy more grocery items like bread, rice, sugar, eggs, milk and oil seeking out the best prices for cash purchases.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, milk and oil.
